Great Location -- Nice European Hotel	Stayed here over the long "Thanksgiving Holiday" - first time to London and thought this is a charming, nice location hotel. I couldn't have been more happy. Compared to other hotels I have stayed in Europe the room wasn't SUPER small....

Nov 23 2009 	Fab Hotel	Stayed for one week at the Cavendish executive room, the service was top notch location very exclusive, within walking distance of Picadilly and Mayfair. Surrounded by fabulous shops and restaurants. Ask for a room in the higher floors, you get a view of the London Eye and Big Ben. Hotel Service is great and very accomodating.

Nov 20 2009 	Great Location nice service small-ish rooms	The Cavendish is very centrally located - my travelling companion and I used our Oyster cards much more rarely than had we stayed further out from central London. It was a 7 minute walk to Trafalgar Sq., or Leicester Sq., and not much further to the ENO or many of the theatres of the West End. The two of us shared an executive king room, which was not overly large, and was a little sparse on storage space, but was otherwise quite comfortable. Breakfast had been included in our rate, and was better than average for a hotel of this level of luxury. The staff was attentive - we ate in the hotel dining room for dinner, and were asked about our meal not only at the time it was served, but also the next morning at breakfast. The only niggling criticisms that I have are that the hangers in the armoire could not be unfastened from the rod (though they were designed to be able to do so), and the "joystick" controls on the bathroom sink were difficult to calibrate temperature and velocity of water, and the very "designer" bowl-shaped sinks were not practical, at least in my experience. The shower and tub were both quite lovely - good water pressure for both, and the tub was large enough to lounge in.

Nov 15 2009 	Great Location and Friendly Staff	This hotel was the first hotel in London to win the "Green Hotel" award so if lowering your impact on the environment while travelling is important to you, this is an accommodation to consider. We stayed one night at the Cavendish while on a shopping and theatre visit. The hotel is tucked away nicely behind Fortnum and Mason and is within easy walking distance of West End theatres and restaurants. Our room was spotlessly clean and all rooms are non-smoking which deserves an award in itself. The staff were friendly and willing to assist with queries.Breakfast was included with our rate and was very delicious with ample and varied selection. The restaurant was very nicely decorated and cheery - wait staff seemed to abound and attended to our every need.The only slight criticism was that room sizes are on the small side but you do expect that in London. There were no robes in the room which would have been a nice touch. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel!!!

Nov 10 2009 	Well Worth the Splurge!	We decided to splurge for our five nights in London last July, at the end of our English family holiday. We were able to get a bit of a deal, by reserving and paying well in advance. And given our package included breakfast, it was not bad value overall.The hotel is lovely - very modern decore and is ideally situated between Picadilly and Green Park subway stops. It is just a short walk to St. James Palace, with Buckingham Palace not too far away. We were wary of hotels near Picadilly, as we'd been told they could be noisy, but this was not the case and we would not hesitate to recommend the Cavendish. And if you are in the market for men's shirts, Jermyn Street had many choices!We were booked into a higher-end room - I believe it was a junior suite. It was located on the top floor. One took the elevator to the top, and then went up a flight of stairs - via some windows with fabulous views of London. Of course, someone carried our bags for us. The room was very large, with great eastward views. There was a very comfortable king bed, and a full-size pull-out couch for our daughter. With the couch open, it was a bit cosy, but there was a whole separate area raised a step or two with another lounging chair and lamp, and a small table. The pull-out couch was fine - but a bit lumpy. However, when I asked for a second duvet, one was brought to us immediately. With that for padding underneath, my daughter was quite content.The bathroom was exquisite - large soaker tub, separate shower, and large vanity with lots of room to put all our things. There were two very large closets with drawers and adequate room to hang clothes for all three of us.The breakfast buffet was plentiful, with good choices and variety day-to-day. Although it would have been hideously expensive to buy on its own, it made our room a reasonably good deal. The breakfast room was quite busy on the weekend, but the service was still very cheerful and competent. Genearlly, we found the staff were very accommodating.Our only complaint at all was the elevators. One was out of service for a couple of days, and with the hotel fully booked, it got a bit slow to get around, especially to breakfast. However, this did nothing to dampen our enthusiasm for such a nice hotel. It was well worth the splurge!

Nov 6 2009 	Excellent centrally situated hotel	We have stayed at the Cavendish before and thoroughly enjoyed it. This time we stayed in a Superior room, and I have to say it was well worth the extra for that extra bit of room. Staff excellent, hotel excellent, general stay excellent. I love coming to this hotel, as it is centrally based for all our "retail therapy" as well as you can park the car (underneath the hotel) overnight at a very reasonable rate. Cannot wait to go back and stay. Truly.Thanks to all the staff at the Cavendish.

Nov 2 2009 	Great stay at the Cavendish....	I booked the Cavendish Hotel for my husbands 30th birthday as a surprise..what a great hotel! the hotel is in a great location, is modern, spotless and very welcoming. We stayed in a double superior room which was spacious and had all the mod coms. before i arrived i had rang the hotel to ask if we could have a room with a view as it was my husbands birthday...The room they gave us was on the 10th floor with amazing views of the London eye, aslo the hotel had a big chocolate cake and birthday card delivered to our room..which i thought was lovely. I would definatley recommend this hotel!!! Great stay in London...!!!

Oct 30 2009 	Sleek Hotel Great Location	I had a very hard time choosing a hotel in London - many of the decent ones were quite expensive, and the ones in my price range were in far-off locations. The Cavendish was a relatively low price for a four star hotel in London, and my travel package came with buffet breakfast, so I decided on this one and am very glad I did. The Cavendish is a sleek, modern hotel located near Picadilly Circus, so the location is excellent. However, it should be noted that the hotel is on a quiet little side street a few blocks AWAY from Picadilly, and I got a little bit lost with all the little winding streets a couple of times. The room was excellent, but it was on the fourth floor and didn't have much of a view - it looked straight into the facade of another building (which, according to my London guide, is actually a very good fancy department store). I would say to ask for a room on a higher floor. It was a bit hard to control the temperature, and it always seemed a bit cold, but the beds were AMAZINGLY soft. It was very hard to get up in the morning!The breakfast is also very good. The buffet is the same everyday and comes with the standard fare: tea, coffee, cereal, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, jam, bagels, etc. It was a good breakfast, but if it doesn't come included in your vacation package, I would recommend not taking it because it's about 30 pounds a day! Definitely not worth it. One thing that irks me about classy hotels is that they feel justified to charge you for internet, which the Cavendish does as well. However, internet is free in the lobby, and they have a very cozy sitting area with many outlets to plug laptops into. If you need to print something out, there are a measly three computers in the lobby, and they are free for 15 minutes of use. Overall, the location was awesome (within walking distance to the touristy areas of Picadilly and even Trafalgar Square), the rooms were comfortable, and the breakfast was good.

Oct 27 2009 	Very nice hotel	We stayed at the Cavendish for three nights. We stayed in a superior room on the 14th floor. The room was small, but the bathroom was large and well-appointed. The view was excellent, especially at night. It's location is top notch for restaurants, pubs and theater. It's a 5 minute walk to tube stops and about 15 to the Thames at Westminster. The decor was a little too trendy and modern for our taste. We didn't find it particularly comfortable. The bar was particularly spartan, hence the lack of patrons. But the lounge on the next floor up was more comfortable, if inconsistent service-wise. The concierge service was very helpful, taking care of our reservations, directions and travel plans.

Oct 27 2009 	Good quality at a reasonable price and great location	We stayed for two nights in October in a classic room. The location was ideal for us with the main theatre district,shopping and many major attractions all within walking distance. Immediately behind Fortnum & Mason on Jermyn Street, the location is quiet and almost perfect for central London.Rooms are a little small compared to many but you can upgrade. Decor is modern and facilities good although it's shower only at the lower end of the price range. The TV was distinguished by having the most complicated menu system of any I've experienced but it's hardly a major issue. The public areas are well appointed but very quiet when we were there. No bar scene here I'm afraid. Breakfast and the main restaurant are on the first floor and some tables have pleasant views of Jermyn Street. You can have breakfast in your room at no extra charge. I recommend it as the wait to be seated in the restaurant was unacceptible on the morning we went (and it was only half full anyway). Choice isn't vast but it was good quality. All the staff were very pleasant - some excellent. This hotel is a great base for a leisure trip to London. It isn't a destination in itself but a stay here will still enhance your trip.

Oct 9 2009 	Great location great staff	Hotel was really central, you could walk to Oxford Street, Bond Street, Regent Street, so right in the main shopping district as well as being able to walk to Buckingham Palace. Other major sightseeing attractions were only a few stops on the tube. Room was great, one of the cleanest we've stayed in. All the staff at the hotel were really friendly and ready to offer their help with anything. Overall a really good stay at a really good hotel.

Oct 8 2009 	Great location excellent service and rooms	Great location excellent staff and service...The only negative was that when teh room was serviced "we stayed for 11 nights" it was never dusted, ever..Apart from that it is definatley where we would stay in London every time

Oct 6 2009 	Cavendish Hotel or Hotel Cavendish?	I was dreading my stay at this hotel as I had booked it before reading the reviews - which were terrible! All I can say is that this hotel is wonderful - location, staff, food and rooms were all fantastic. On returning home I checked the reviews and realised that there is also a Cavendish Hotel (or is it Hotel Cavendish?) in Gower Street, Bloomsbury, and that had been the hotel reviews I had read. Surely this must cause problems with people booking the wrong hotel, and from the revews, I think this must be the case.The staff at the Cavendish, Jermyn Street, are really friendly and welcoming and our room, although a bit small, was perfectly formed! The comfiest bed I've ever slept in, and a beautiful bathroom with lots of soft fluffy towels. The breakfasts were delicious and we also had a pre-theatre dinner where the food was excellent. We had a view of the London Eye from our window which was lovely to see all lit up at at night. We stayed four nights and did not use the tube once - anywhere you could possibly want to go is within walking distance of this central hotel. I would stay at this hotel again whenever in London.

Sep 26 2009 	BOOK IT!	I stayed at the Cavendish for 9 days and I think it was worth every penny! The location is great (by tube stations, entertainment, food, shopping, theater), staff are oh so helpful and amazing, the rooms are so clean and lovely, breakfast is great and freshly made.The hotel is in a nice cute side street by Piccadilly and it takes about 3 min to get to Piccadilly station and about 5 min to Green park. There are different restaurants and bars with in walking distance. since the area is somewhat touristy I found it very lively till very late at night and very safe to walk around. Make sure to walk everywhere since Regent street, Carnaby and bond street are all the clubs are about 5-15 min walk from the hotel. So take advantage of that. The hotel rooms are very clean and the beds are the most comfortable beds I have every slept on. one of the great services they offer is you can order your breakfast in bed if you dont want to wake up early to catch the buffet hours in the morning. just make sure you fill out the form fr it the night before and hang it out by 2am. Its good for wkend mornings. for internet they have 15 min passes for free, 30 min i think for 5 and 60 min for 10 and so on. We used the computers in the lobby pretty much everyday so we just used the free 15min passes.i read some reviews about the hotel saying the rooms were too small. we had the superior room and it was fine for 2 people. again London hotels are usually small and i thought for the location and the fact that the hotel is not that new at least our room for pretty good size.i cant think of any negative points about the hotel. so just book it! im sure you'll like it!

Sep 22 2009 	Amazing location and friendly staff.	We stayed a week at the Cavendish and truly enjoyed our stay. The location can't be beat, within walking distance of two Tube stops, Soho and the West End, Buckingham Palace and other major tourist attractions as well as some of London's best shopping. The bed was exceedingly comfy and the room quite roomy by London standards. The staff were relentlessly cheerful and helpful. The only downside: our room was a communicating room with the one next door, and voices travelled trough the doors. However, I would love to stay at the Cavendish again.

Sep 21 2009 	Fanatastic	Just returned from a wonderful weekend staying at the Cavendish. Had booked on line got a great deal, then got upgraded to a suite.. We use to be regular visitors to this hotel in the past, but for some reason the last time we went ,about 5 years ago, something put us off and we did not return untill this weekend. Mainly due to the positive reviews on TP. The Cavendish was great. Location is unbeatable, everything in close walking distance. We had breakfast served in our room, arrived spot on 10 o'clock as requested. Nice touch was the follow up phone call checking we had everything we wanted. Could not fault the hotel or especially the staff. We will return.PS If you are lucky enough to get a suite ask to face East I think the view is probably better.

Sep 20 2009 	LocationLocation Location!	This was my first trip to London and I chose to stay at the Cavendish after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor and loved it. My husband and I stayed in a superior room which some reviewers complain is small but c'mon, if your staying in London you really shouldn't have an excuse to be spending that much time in your room anyway! The Superior room boasts a comfy queen size bed with a tall headboard and small but modern outfitted bathroom with shower/bathtub and a heated towel rack. The beds were very soft with thick duvets and I had no problems falling asleep. Anytime we came back from an outing our room was always spotless and smelled fantastic, in fact the whole hotel smells awesome. Everyone from reception, concierge and housekeeping were very helpful and friendly and eager to please. Another plus is that the hotel has won awards for it's sustainabilty efforts, which is pretty cool. We did not indulge in the breakfasts as there are so many places close by where you can grab a fast bite to eat , like the Tesco market or pret a manger cafes. Also the Fortnum and Mason department store across from the Cavendish has a really great Ice cream Parlour that is fabulous! I can't say enough how convenient the location was as it is between two tube stations Piccadilly Circus and Green Park and really within walking distance of so many attractions. There also is so much fantastic shopping close by on Oxford street and Bond street that I was able to frequently drop off shopping parcels back to the room to hide before my husband came back from his museum outings haha. My one problem was the nightclub beside Fortnum's had some loud revelers during the weekend so it was a little noisy, that's no fault of the Cavendish though and other than that it was pretty quiet. Overall I really loved my stay at the Cavendish and I would definitely stay here again when visiting London.

Sep 13 2009 	Short City Trip	Visited the Cavendish Hotel on Jermyne Street which we booked on short notice after deciding to go on a short city trip to London. We found to hotel to be very well located (St. James's/Mayfair), the room to be very good although a bit smaller than we expected (it was a 'superior room') with excellent batchroom and facilities. It was a nice touch to see that the usual plastic keycard was changed into a similar plastic thing but this time old-fashioned key shaped ;-)The hotel is in a quiet side street just off Picadilly, without the street noise that goes with a big city. Room is with automatic airconditioning that starts when you enter the room automatically - something we don't like so that was a manual switch off every time. Window could be opened but only for some 15cm / 6 inches, which is not how we like it but what airco'ed hotel offers full open windows nowadays?We booked an advanced payment which included the breakfast buffet, and we liked it. Coffee and toast if asked was brought to the table and the buffet was good - not outrageous but decent. Oh - they did have trouble with coffee brewing though - either too weak or too strong.The room was furnished with nice pillows/cushions, earth-coloured materials. Very soft and comfortable bed, no wooden plank at the end (i'm kinda tall) so plenty of room. Room contained the standard coffee/tea brewer and also an electricity converter which we brought ourselves.Overall a very good hotel, not too expensive given the great spot in the city amidst the best streets for shopping (our main purpose for the short stay) and we definitely would go back the next time.

Sep 11 2009 	quiet hotel in the heart of the city	The hotel is in an excellent location within a posh area of london and most things are within walking distance. The rooms are well presented and at breakfast there was a wide selection all of good quality. Nice hotel for a short city break.

Sep 9 2009 	Great Location and Great Deal	I was able to book this hotel at a discounted rate on hotels.com that included breakfast, which was convenient. The rooms were clean and the service was great. The concierge was very accommodating and helped make my stay in London seamless.

Sep 7 2009 	Excellent Stay at the Cavendish	We enjoyed a one night stay at the Cavendish. I would echo previous comments about this Hotel. Decor is excellent, breakfast superb and everywhere spotlessly clean. However the rooms aren't exactly huge. We booked an Executive room and it was OK size wise so the basic rooms must be a squeeze.Overall The Cavendish is highly recommended.

Sep 2 2009 	Rooms way to small-great location	The Cavendish is a nice hotel and conveniently located however I stayed in a classic double room with a friend and it was incredibly small. I struggled getting my two suitcases into the room and definitely couldn't open my two bags at the same time. Even if I was by myself it would have been a little tight but I would have been able to better deal with it. I brought up my dissatification with the room size to the manager and he was not all accomodating or seemed the least bit interested in what I was saying. I'm from Washington D.C. and this vacation was my very first to the UK. Because I was so far away from home I was willing to be for convenience and comfort. I didn't receive an adequate comfort level and will not select this hotel for future visits to the UK.

Sep 1 2009 	Highly recommended - I loved it!	Stayed for one night at the end of august - me for leisure and my partner for business. Can't fault this hotel in any way - we received a complimentary upgrade on arrival and were offered drinks discounts at their bar. The room (superior) was lovely with a big flat screen tv, a DAB radio and CD player and the most amazing view across London which I could see from the comfort of my bed. The bed was possibly the comfiest I have ever had the fortune to sleep in and the bathroom was beautiful and most importantly very clean! Our room was right next to a lift however I never heard any noise the whole time I was there, in fact I wasn't disturbed by anything and given half a chance could have slept forever!On arriving for breakfast we were seated straight away and once again I cannot fault it - my eggs benedict were perfect and the service from the staff was first class - I didn't need to eat until dinnertime!I spent some time in their lounge during the morning and I was so well looked after by very attentive waiters.All in all, The Cavendish comes highly recommended - its very central and I really enjoyed my stay - in fact I'd stay here at least once a week if it was up to me!

Aug 30 2009 	Outstanding!!	We stayed in a junior suite and it was faultless.Service was great, the room was spotless and the bed was huge!!Views over the city were fantastic!!Well worth going for a junior suite for a special occasion.

Aug 25 2009 	Great location great hotel	The main reason for staying in this hotel has to be its location - at the back door of Fortnum and Masons (just off Piccadilly) this is just a short walk away from the main sites (Regents St., Oxford St, Leicester Square and Shaftesbury Ave). The entrance is low key and the reception area is modern. The reception staff and concierge were very helpful. As we were staying there for a birthday, they put a cake and a card in the room for us, which was a lovely touch and certainly the only time that has happened before! The room was very nice - exceptionally clean and modern with everything you'd need, plus some little extras, like an iron and ironing board. A 42" TV and a CD player and a queen sized bed made the room very luxurious. Although the room is a little on the small side, we expected that being a central London hotel, and was certainly of adequate if not ample size. The bathroom was very modern and made you feel like you were staying somewhere a little bit special. We paid 150 ish for the hotel with breakfast (which was a quite average buffet serve-yourself affair) and were not disappointed with what we got for our money. We'd go back there again.

Aug 24 2009 	Luxury?	The hotel claims to be 4 star Luxury but dont expect to get this in the Standard Double. The bed in my room was designed for people no taller than 58 so was not entirely comfortable for me at 62 tall. This may be so that there was room to get past the end of the bed in the narrow room. Unfortunately this spoilt what would have been a perfect stay at the hotel. The hotel is in a great location, the staff were all pleasant and helpful and the breakfast buffet very good (included in the room price).We stayed a Friday and Saturday night and even though the hotel was full on the Saturday (I tried to upgrade for the second night) it seemed very quiet. I would stay there again but would have to pay more to ensure I get the luxury of a decent bed.

Aug 24 2009 	Don't choose "classic room"!!	The hotel is not bad, but the rooms are too too too... small. I stayed in the classic room and choose this hotel because it has breakfast included and I did read good reviews about. Choose for this hotel ONLY if you will not stay in "classic room".

Aug 23 2009 	Best value by far	WE have just returned from another very pleasant stay. Not much needs to be said - this continues to be the best price / location / breakfast value hotel in this area of London.

Aug 23 2009 	Fine Central London Hotel!	Stayed for one night at The Cavendish on the basis of previous reviews and I have to agree with many others that this is an excellent hotel. Superbly situated in St James' and within easy walking distance of major attractions and the West End we had a room on the 9th Floor with good open views. The room was an excellent size and was very well equiped, particularly in respect of the state of the art TV and entertainment system. We did not use any of the hotels facilities so cannot comment on this but the price (booked through Expedia) was reasonable for this part of London on our past experience. A familiar moan though about why London hotels cannot include breakfast in the cost when you are paying 150+ for accommodation!

Aug 22 2009 	I feared the worst	Having read so many negative reviews of both hotel staff and the manager Ciaran in particular, it was with a certain amount of trepidation that I booked this hotel. I chose it because of its proximity to Trafalgar Square and because they were offering an online reduced rate deal. Its location alone was worth the money but any fears that I had weren't realised as we had a first class stay. The concierge was excellent as were the house and breakfast staff. The reception staff and porters though could have done with some training in civility.The room was spotless and very quiet. we had ordered a cot for our 1 year old in advance and arrived to an open futon which wasn't suitable. This was resolved within minutes as was the difficult tuning of our tv. A word of caution however. We had removed all of the items from the minibar as we wanted to use it to keep our daughters food cool. The next day I noticed that we had been charged for every item, 74. I explained that we didn't drink the contents and that they were still in the room. The receptionist informed us through clenched teeth that it was a minibar and not a fridge. It is only 9 degrees c and not suitable to prevent bacteria from forming in milk and baby food. Fair point. I didn't get charged in the end. Breakfast is 21 per head so watch out if it isn't included in your stay. Tesco down the street has an amazing selection of fresh food and great drink should you require anything. It has also won loads of awards for its 'green' credentials. I could write a whole review on this alone.

Aug 19 2009 	Wonderful place to stay	My husband, two sons age 20 and 17, and I spent two nights at The Cavendish London after a week visiting my husband's parents in Cambridge. We could not have been happier. We had two Superior rooms, one with a queen bed and one with two twins. Neither was especially large, but both were very comfortable. The views from our rooms out across London were wonderful and the views from the windows at the south end of the corridor on our floor were even better. The breakfast included with our room rate was exceptionally good.As others have said, the hotel is in a great location. It's close to lots of the things most people want to see when they come to London, but on a very quiet street. We walked to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, the theater and several of the central London parks. We had Oyster cards for travel on the Underground, but used them very little. The concierge was able to recommend several nice nearby pubs for lunch and dinner, though he seemed less familiar with moderately-priced restaurants in the area. Overall, the staff was very helpful without being at all intrusive.At 169 pounds per room per night, this was a bit of a splurge for us, but definitely worth it for the comfortable stay and the location. We had seen advertisements for smaller Standard rooms at the hotel starting at 129 pounds per room per night; none were available for our travel dates, but even the Superior rooms were not large and, judging from the plan for our floor, the Standard rooms would have seemed very small. Still, given the hotel's other amenities, if available they would be very good value.
Aug 13 2009	Excellent Hotel	This hotel ticks all the boxes. Nothing at all to complain about, and I am looking forward to staying again.

Aug 12 2009 	Fantastic Hotel - Book book book!	Love this hotel. The other reviews here all seem to agree, so not much for me to say! Go for the Executive rooms if you can - well worth it. Request a high floor. Get breakfast included - its a really good spread. If your stay is for a special occasion let them know in advance - we got a REALLY nice birthday cake. Keep it up Cavendish; I will be back!

Aug 11 2009 	Lovely London Hotel!	We stayed at The Cavendish in late July for five nights and loved it! The location is fantastic and the rooms are nicely decorated and very clean and the staff was very helpful. We loved that our breakfast was included in the price of the room! It was so nice to walk downstairs and start out a long day of sightseeing with a delicious breakfast. Staying here helped make our first trip to London completely wonderful! We will be back!

Aug 9 2009 	good value great location	we booked this hotel for my birthday weekend and called ahead to organise a bottle of champagne. when we arrived in the room the champagne followed along with a birthday cake & card courtesy of the hotel! the room was small but well equiped. the clenliness could have been better though (hairs in the shower).the first morning our room service order was lost but they made up for it by delivering two breakfasts extremely quickly once the error had been raised.do not book this hotel if you want to spend a lot of time in your room, the location is great & we had a fantastic view which included the gherkin, london eye & big ben

Aug 3 2009 	Absolutely Fabulous Hotel - Everything Perfect	My wife and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary this weekend and have had a fantastic time. The hotel is in a perfect location just minutes from Piccadilly on foot.From when we arrived on Saturday morning to when we left on Sunday afternoon we were treated like royalty. The staff were always polite, friendly and smiling. Nothing was too much trouble.On our arrival we were dealt with straight away by the reception staff, and, as it was a special occasion we were given a complimentary upgrade from our superior double to an executive double room. The room on the 12th floor was fantastic, just the right size with amazing views across London. We could see the London Eye, St Pauls Cathedral, everything - it was fantastic.The room itself was spotless with everything you could want. The bathroom had a double shower and bath - all immaculate.On Sunday morning our breakfast was delivered to our room spot on time at 08.45 and everything was cooked to perfection and was hot too. We were able to eat our breakfast in the comfort of our own room whilst overlooking London.This Hotel is by far the best hotel that I have ever stayed in and will definitely be back to stay here again - hopefully soon.

Jul 31 2009 	Great location and a fantastic breakfast	This is the hotel to stay if you want a great spot in London (5 minute walking from picadilly circus). The rooms are confortable, great bed, great view over London. The breakfast amazing. One suggestion to improve: Improve the elevators (long time waiting before getting one).

Jul 31 2009 	Excellent hotel plus outstanding service!	Stayed in the hotel for a short break for my 21st birthday. Upon arrival i received a complimentary upgrade to a top floor superior room. Reception, bar and restaurant staff all brilliant. After a couple of hours i returned to my room to find a birthday cake and a card from the hotel! Views amazing. Perfect location. situated within walking distance to Bukingham Palace, Oxford Sreet and West End Shows. Cant wait to return!

Jul 29 2009 	Great Value in Great Location	For the price there is little doubt that The Cavendish is one of the best bargains in London. If the primary purpose of your stay is theatre, there is no better location. It is easy walking distance to all the West End and The National and yet it's located on quiet Jermyn Street across the road from Fortnum & Mason. Superior Room on the 11th floor had amazing views, top notch decor, wall mounted flat screen, spotless bath and was of a good size by London standards. Never once heard either street noise or other guests. The rate included a superb breakfast buffet including fresh juice, fruit salad, Scottish smoked salmon, a wide assortment of jams and wonderful pan de chocolat. In addition you can opt for a cooked to order full English breakfast or ala carte items such as eggs benedict at no extra charge. If you prefer, breakfast can be served in your room again at no extra charge. The staff couldn't be more courteous and helpful (a couple of minor billing discrepancies were quickly and pleasantly resolved) and free lobby WIFI access from a comfortable seat in the hotel lounge was a bonus. After more than thirty trips to London, I've finally found THE place to stay.

Jul 24 2009 	Tight space but great location.	My wife and I stayed here on the first part of our honeymoon. We upgraded for 20 BP per night for the "larger" room ... which was still tight, but good. Very shiek hotel & room interior. Our room rate had breakfast included -- which was a good option.... the buffet was varied enough to satisfy most anyone. Remember to ask for toast or english muffin etc-- they will toast one up and bring it to your table - nice.You cannot beat the location -- walking to Picadilly & Regent St is a snap; there are many great pubs for dinner/snacks/drinks nearby...one in particular, recommended by the hotel was the "Blue Post" -- very packed, but great food at resonable prices.The only weirdness -- perhaps it's a British thing -- was the shower. The "door" was just a short glass partition that didn't really do much good in keeping the water from going beyon the tub. Even with care, we'd get the sink area wet....of course it could just be us.We didn't use the on-premise pub etc...they were a bit pricy for us.

Jul 20 2009 	Outstanding service location and food.	Our family of 4 had 2 rooms at this stylish european hotel. A full English breakfast was included with the room. The restaurant was fabulous, the daily breakfast included a buffet as well as eggs cooked to order. The eggs benedict were superb. We enjoyed dinner twice at the hotel, once a pre-theatre special. Both meals were outstanding, I had a hard time convincing my family to eat anywhere else. However, when we did try other local restaurants we found the food and service to be excellent as well. One standout was the Al Duca Italian restaurant just around the corner from the hotel. The food was great and it provided a true contemporary Italian experience right in the heart of London.The Cavendish is very conveniently located just 3 blocks from Piccadilly Circus, but far enough away that you can avoid the Piccadilly noise and crowds. It is within easy walking distance to Trafalger Square and Buckingham palace.In typical London style, the rooms are small but very comfortable. The quality of the materials used in the rooms was top notch and very elegant.My one complaint was the lack of reasonably price internet service. While you can get free wireless service in the lobby, if you want service in your room you will pay 20 pounds daily for the privilege, at the current exchange rate that is $32. In room service was wired only which doesn't help if you're using an iPhone or iPod touch. We just wanted to be able to plan our sightseeing days and having to do it in the lobby was very inconvenient.If you can live with the internet service issue then I would highly recommend the Cavendish.

Jul 17 2009 	Great job Cavendish!	The Cavendish is wonderful hotel. Its stylish, clean, comfortable and you will be treated like a dignified guest staying in a luxury boutique hotel in the posh part of town. So many hotels in London are overpriced, dank and feel like your grandmothers outdated parlor. This isnt one of them. Other reviews cover the basics, so here is the important stuff. We stayed in a superior twin room, and didnt think it was small. Two girls, two large suitcases, and lots of stuff all fit. Bathrooms are well lit and modern. Water pressure is great. Linens are new. Beds are very comfortable. Black out curtains for sleeping in. Good sized televisions with plenty of channels. We got a great advanced rate that included breakfast and VAT. The hotel was actually nicer than we anticipated given the relatively small price difference between the Cavendish and 3 star hotels in London. (As an aside, I visited friends staying at the more expensive Holiday Inn Mayfair, just 2 blocks awayits dumpy, dark, smellythis is a much better hotel. Think W Hotel vs. well, Holiday Inn). Aside from the comfortable accommodations, what we liked most was the location and the service. The location really cant be beat. We were able to walk to just about everythingGreen Park tube station is around the corner, as is Piccadilly Circus; parks; museums; major tourist attractions; shopping and the Thames River. Two years ago I stayed at the Darlington Hyde Park and much, much, much preferred this part of the cityattractions, dining, shopping are all more accessible and better quality as this is one of the best neighborhoods. The staff is extremely accommodating and polite. They delivered ice, juices and made cheese sandwiches especially for us in the early hours of the morning. They also didnt freak out when friends visited late at night for drinks and were less than quiet. Very professional. Breakfast is great, especially if its included in the price of your stay. Eggs are made to order; coffee is delivered to your table; everything is fresh and you can take a plate up to the room for later. They will also deliver breakfast if you order it the night before. This hotel delivers quality and a little luxory at a reasonable price. Overall great. I intend to stay here from now on.

Jul 16 2009 	The Cavendish - what a great place!!	Hi there,I've just returned home from a great stay at The Cavendish - I found everything about the hotel to be fantastic, in fact, I haven't one complaint! I noticed in previous reviews that some people said the rooms were small and I admit mine wasn't huge but in a city like London you don't spend much time in your hotel or I don't...I'm always too busy exploring!! The location of the hotel is second to none...I barely had to get the tube it was that central (always a bonus in the Summer as the tube gets very hot!) But on days when I did, both Green Park and Piccadilly Circus were within 5 minutes walking distance.And the breakfast buffet is good here too - lots to choose from from bacon & eggs, cheese, ham, cereal, fruit etc.So, all in all I would definitely recommend this hotel

Jul 14 2009 	Great Location beautiful room super views	We stayed at the Cavendish for one night following a cruise. I had booked an executive room, but when we arrived they said for 30 pounds more we could have the penthouse with terrace. We said ok and it was truly worth it. The penthouse is very large, on the 15th (top floor) with stairs up to the floor from the 14th floor elevator. The living room had two sliding doors with a large terrace that overlooked London and had a wonderful view of the Eye, Big Ben, Parliament, St. Pauls, the pickle and Westminster.The bed was king sized and very comfortable. The bathroom was large with separate shower and bath and eco-green bath amenities. The only thing I could quibble with is that they only left two towels total. It was our anniversary celebration and the staff sent up a delicious chocolate cake!We had to leave for the Heathrow Express at 6:10 am and breakfast which was included didn't start until 6:30 am. However, the staff prepared a beautiful breakfast tray of fruit bowl, croissants, juice and coffee for us in our room. It was wonderful!We would stay here again anytime we are in London. The location, near Piccadilly on Jermyn Street is fabulous.

Jul 13 2009 	Be aware of the cancellation policy	My husband has stayed at this hotel many times on business mainly for its central location. I booked it today for tomorrow through our regular booking site hotels london and realised as soon as I read the confirmation that I had booked for today by accident. I immediately emailed the booking agent who called the hotel straightaway. They advised that tomorrow is full, although their website is still showing rooms available and that they can do nothing but cancel the booking and retain all the payment. Their website's reservation page says "check or modify a booking" and I can't find where their cancellation regulations are laid out either so he will not be staying here again, just thought others should be aware not to let their finger slip.

Jul 8 2009 	Stylish compact hotel in a perfect location	I'd bought DH tickets to see Kings of Leon at the O2 for Christmas. After some searching, we decided to go for the Cavendish based on the good reviews on TA, central location and reasonable price (got an early booking discount direct on their website).Was really easy to get to from Euston, even with the Victoria line out of action - just one change. It's about a 10-15 min walk from Green Park with our luggage, about 5-10 without. The hotel doesn't have a massive facade like some others do so not easy to spot immediately -but you can easily spot it because it is directly opposite Fortnum and Mason's.Check-in service was excellent. I'd requested a high-floor room when I booked on the website but because one wasn't available at that time, we were given a complimentary upgrade. Bonus! We were also given some vouchers to use at the bar at for the pre-theatre dinner menu at the restaurant.When we got to our room, our first impression was that it was very stylish BUT it was very small - if that was an upgrade, wonder what a standard room size was?! However, there was everything you needed - hairdryer, iron, big flatscreen TV. The bathroom was equally compact but not cramped. Really nice range of toiletries too. Am assuming that the small size of the room is a reflection of the age of the building and that it may have had a previous life as an office, something other than a hotel anyway!One thing that is clear with the Cavendish is that they are very green - impressively so. The toiletries were in recyclable plastic sachets which significantly reduces waste. There was no hotel brochure - all information was available through the TV, reducing paper usage. Everything that could be reduced, reused or recycled was reduced, reused or recycled! Really encouraging to see that this kind of green thinking is possible in a fairly big hotel.The breakfast was delicious - really wide choice of good quality local food. Staff were pleasant and efficient. And even better for us bedheads, they serve right up to midday at the weekend!The bar is really stylish but quite small. Really nice selection of spirits and table service too. However, it is popular with business types - lots of power lunches going on! And fair enough - would rather hold a meeting there than in a pokey office....but it's not fun for other patrons, felt we had to speak with lowered voices so as not to disturb them!To top off the trendy styling and friendly service, the hotel is in a FAB location. As I said, right opposite Fortnum and Mason's, a few minutes' walk from Picadilly and Regent Street. And if you're going to the O2, it's only 15 mins direct on the Tube (think it's the Jubilee line).I loved this hotel and I'm sure we will use it our base for any future trips to London.

Jul 8 2009 	READ THE RIGHT REVIEW (iam a pillock)	The wife & i have been wanting to stay at the Cavendish Hotel on JERMYN STREET, for ages and as a birthday treat the wife booked for us to stay for the weekend and to go and watch Oliver as i love Oliver. So let me just say that the hotel was very nice the food very good, and very well situated walking distance to most of the sight's. the room and bathroom were on the small side but very nice (superior room) and all the ammenities you require,and would definetly stay here again. there were no problems. Jul 5 2009 	A Great Base	This was our second stay here and again it was faultless.We stayed just for 1 night for the Hard Rock Calling festival at nearby Hyde Park.The check in was efficient and the room we had , an executive room on the top floor, was really nice with great views of the london skyline and also very very clean.One massive bonus for this hotel is the breakfast,I think it is the best breakfast you can have at a hotel in London and its included in the room rate.The location is brilliant(just behind Fortnum and Mason) so all in all a winner

Jun 23 2009 	Modern clean and comfortable boutique hotel in a great location	I had read all of the reviews prior to my trip and I must say that this hotel definitely deserves all of the positive feedback. The primary reason for my trip was for business during the week. I stayed in Windsor during the week and then moved to central London along with my husband who joined me for the weekend. We are both in our early 30s - no kids, yet! The location is perfect. It is easy to get to and from the airport. The Tube will take you right to Green Park or Picadilly Circus - both about a 5 minute walk to the hotel. It is a little cumbersome with luggage, but this was by far the most cost-efficient mode of transportation. When we arrived at the hotel, it looked exactly as it had in the pictures, which is always a good thing! The woman at reception was very nice. I had requested a room away from the lift and on an upper floor. Both of these requests were honored. We had booked a Superior Room (upon recommendation from a friend who had stayed here). I highly recommend a Superior Room (minimally). I can't imagine the size of the Classic Room b/c the Superior Room was tiny. However, it was exactly what I was expecting. And, as many other reviewers have mentioned, how much time do you actually spend in your hotel room? Plus, it was modern and super clean. The bathroom was actually big relative to the size of the room. And the bed was super comfy! It is a little difficult to find places for 2 suitcases, but we managed just fine. The room was actually quite cozy - in a good way. Although the hotel was fully booked while we were there, we did not hear any TV, voices, etc... coming from any of the rooms or hallway. Our rate included breakfast so we took advantage of that every morning. It was a buffet that offered everything imaginable from the traditional English breakfast to cereal, yogurt, and fruit. Although it was really good, I don't think we would have eaten here if it wasn't included in our rate. It cost 21 pounds a person! I think that is a bit excessive - even by London standards! Speaking of excessive...the charge for Internet access is crazy. I think it was 20 pounds for 24 hours. I travel quite a bit (albeit mostly in the US) and free wireless is pretty much becoming the standard. Anyway, there is a way around this. If you go to reception, they will give you a code for a free 15 minutes on the lobby computers. This was perfect for doing a quick search for a restaurant, checking in for our flight, and checking Facebook :-) Back to the location...it really is perfect. I had only been to London once before so I was not familiar with my surroundings besides what I knew from a map. I can say that most major tourist attractions are within walking distance. We even walked to the Tower of London, which I don't recommend. It's not that it was a bad walk, but it did take over an hour so you just need to plan your day accordingly. In addition to a lot of the tourist attractions, there are also a ton of places to eat within close walking distance. If you are looking for inexpensive, there is an EAT, Costa Coffee and Pret a Manger on almost every street. And, if you want something more upscale, there are plenty of options in Soho, Leicester Square, and Covent Garden. And, of course, tons of pubs if you are looking for some ale and Fish & Chips. If you are looking for clothing shopping, I would recommend Oxford St. It has all the big (reasonably priced) fashionable stores like Next, H&M, Topshop,etc... This is also where the big toy store "Hamleys" is located. If you want to go to the theater, I would recommend checking out the half-price ticket booth in Leicester Square. It's only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I know a lot of this information is not directly related to the hotel. However, I think the "stuff" around the hotel is almost as important as the hotel itself. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to others. I have a couple of very, very minor negatives. One, is the key. It is really cool, but my husband had it in his back pocket and must have sat on it weird. So, it stopped working and we got locked out of the room. This can easily be avoided. My other negative is the lack of exercise room. I work out 4 times a week and I was really missing my work-outs. However, I think I more than made up for it with all of the walking! Lastly, if you are travelling with children, I would book the next room level up. The Superior Room would be much too small for more than 2 people.As a side note, I would highly recommend a day trip to Windsor. It is lovely and the tour of the Castle is worh the money. There is a train from Waterloo to Windsor. It's about a 45 minute ride. I think it cost around 10 pounds.

Mar 20 2009 	Excellent Service	We would most definitely stay at the Cavendish again. We had a great rate, and you cant beat the location as it is within walking distance of so many popular sites. Occasionally, we would hear someone roll luggage down the hall, but that was rare and during the daynot at night. Our room was just a short ways down from the elevator, but we never heard them. I even asked one to print out a coupon for me, and he never hesitated, even though the form required him to fill out some information for me. Jan 3 2009 	Great Location Friiendly and Professional Staff	Stayed on the 9th floor for 4 nights. Very good location and the bed was comfortable. Dec 29 2008 	Great base for theatre and shopping	We stayed in this hotel for one night on a trip to London to celebrate my husband's birthday. Intended to see Les Mis and shop. Dec 21 2008 	Not the usual square box	I've stayed in three different rooms at the Cavendish this year, each has been different in size and shape. I did complain about this, and I was moved room and offered a complimentary breakfast for two.I like The Cavendish because it offers quality accomodation at a reasonable price, in a fantastic location. There are deals to be had, check the American discount sites, Travelzoo, Hotwire etc. It is my theory that some European hotels only offer deals on the American sites in the hope that any booking will be for more than one or two nights, and better revenue for the hotel.There is no loyalty scheme in place, but once registered as a guest, you are the first to here of future offers - which can be very good. Dec 16 2008 	Great Hotel Even Better Location!!!	Having decided to bring my wife to London, to see 'Dirty Dancing' (her favourite film) for her birthday, the race was on to find a decent hotel, with a reasonable price and a great location. Bought 2 tickets (single tickets to Green Park 8), down the escalators and onto the tube. So easy! The tube did get busy the more we got into the city, however, people we friendly. Altough, the hotel is about a 5 minute walk (in the lashing rain!) from the tube, I would probably get off at Picadilly the next time. We arrived at the hotel, which is located on the very quiet Jermyn St, to be greeted with a smile at reception. The receiption staff are very friendly and efficient. We were given the option of having a room on a higher or lower floor. We choose a high floor for the views - room 1108. I booked a standard room as we were only staying for one night (due to having no annual leave left!). The rooms are small - average sized for London - and very stylish. Nice comfy bed, flat screen TV, CD player, nice bathroom, etc. As this was our first time staying in London, the location aspect was important as I didn't want us wasting limited time on public transport. We definitely weren't disappointed with the Location of this hotel. The hotel is basically a very short walking distance to the likes of Picadilly, Leicester Sq, Regent St, Oxford St., Bond st, etc. And prices in London are notably cheaper than Dublin.This is a great hotel and I would highly recommend it for a city break in London. We will definitely be back.

Dec 5 2008 	Doubt we would go back	Stayed at the hotel many times, very central and a perfect position for the shops. Dec 3 2008 	My favorite London hotel....	I just completed two seperate stays at this hotel, at the beginning and end of a trip to Ireland in November. Housekeeping standards are very high. Room service food way above average and FAST, however I wish the menu selection was larger. However we had Sunday brunch at Christopher's, near Covent Garden, which I can highly recommend. The hotel itself had a nice relaxed atmosphere, when we got back from the Theatre around midnight the bar was open with a few people having a night cap . Our room was on the 11th Floor right next to the lift, but we didn't have any disturbance from the lifts at all.All in all a fantastic stay and a great location. Tips if you are taking a car:There is no congestion Charge in London at the weekend.Street parking is free from 6.30pm on Saturday around the Hotel.Westminster Council Car Parks (Leicester Square) have a Theatreland 50% discount if you are seeing a show. http://www.westminster.gov.uk/Carparks/theatreland.cfm

Jul 23 2008 	Perfect weekend	Having scoured the reviews of available London hotels for a birthday weekend treat, the Cavendish seemed like a pretty safe bet. I was not disapointed. Location was fantastic and we were able to walk everywhere. We were offered a room upgrade for an extra 40 on arrival - glad we decided to do this as the new room was not exactly huge - but very smart and comfortable with a luxurious bathroom. Breakfast was delicious - especially if you order from the menu. Not an inexpensive hotel - but you get what you pay for!

Jul 22 2008	The Classy Cavendish	We have enjoyed two weekend breaks at the Cavendish in January 2008 when we went to the Tutankhamun and Terracotta Army exhibitions and May 2008 when we went to see Bruce Springsteen at the Emirates Stadium. Staying at this super hotel made sure both our weekends were really enjoyable.The hotel staff are efficient and friendly. If you ask for a room with a view you will not be disappointed when you see the London skyline at dusk and dawn. The hotel is situated behind Fortnum and Mason and is ideal for sightseeing and shopping. A delicious English breakast was included in our room rate and the room was large and very comfortable. We are already looking forward to our next visit.

Jul 20 2008 	Fabulous Hotel!	We spent 2 nights at The Cavendish in a Superior Queen room. The room was a decent size for London and the bathroom was very spacious with White Company toiletries. The walls were a little thin, but it wasn't too disturbing. The view from our room which was on the 14th floor was amazing - you could see the Gherkin, St Pauls, Nelson's Column, The London Eye and even Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament. Air con was useful as you can't open the windows and it can get a bit stuffy. The TV has a selection of satellite channels which includes Sky Sports which is a nice bonus.Breakfasts were fantastic, huge range of fruits, yoghurts, cold meats and cereals. Also a wide selection of pastries and croissants. On the Friday the cooked breakfasts are ordered via a waiter and brought to your table. On the Saturday the cooked breakfast was a buffet style, but if you wanted anything different you could still order off the menu. I would recommend getting the breakfast included in your room rate as we did, because at 21 per person plus 12.5% service charge, it is pretty steep!Staff on reception and the concierge desk were very friendly and efficient. I would not hesittate in recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in central London. The walk to Picadilly tube is only about 1 minute which is really convenient, and there is a Tesco Metro at the end of Jermyn Street (towards Picadilly) as well if you need any supplies.

Jul 14 2008 	Nice modern rooms - great location	Stayed here for one evening at a weekend. Superior rooms at the Grosvenor (marriot) on Park Lane are much nicer but are a bit more pricey. Apart from that, good hotel.

Jul 13 2008 	Great Location - OK Hotel	Firstly, this hotel is in an excellent location and worth considering for that reason alone. It is directly behind Fortnum & Mason and less that 5 minutes walk to Piccadilly Circus!However, we were staying for a special occasion and for this, I don't think I would recommend it to others. We paid for a junior suite for the weekend (250per night) and despite me stating on booking that it was a birthday celebration we were still given a fairly small ish room right next to the lift workings (as the lifts don't go to the top floor) and facing the opposite way to the river. When I asked for a better room the receptionist claimed that noone had ever complained about one of their suites before or any noise from the lfts (which is a bit hard to believe as it made a fairly continuous banging sound) and made us feel very awkward for asking. After a lot of huffing and puffing we were given a different suite that was at least twice the size and had a corner position (same price and clasification, so bear this is mind when staying). The rooms are OK but in need of some maintanence, 1 example is that a hole in the bathroom wall above the sink had been filled with what looked like tissue and then left? Breakfast is not good (really sloppy eggs that didn't look healthy at all) and the service was quite poor and fairly slow. On the Sunday morning we had to wait over 20 minutes to be seated as there was a queue of at least 18-20 people, which made us late to meet friends.A mention though that on the Sunday (my partners birthday) they did leave a cake in the room for him which was a nice thought, although we were out all day and only found it late when we got back, so it didn't get eaten.If you just need somewhere convenient to stay then do stay here in one of the basic rooms, but if you're looking for something to splash out on or to spoil someone, I'd pay the bit extra for a really special hotel as this one is likely to leave you really a bit ripped off.

Jul 10 2008 	everything I wanted	Very freindly and easy going staff. Location was brilliant, as were the facilities and comfort. Rooms were very clean, had a 'new' feel about them and offered plenty of space.

Jul 2 2008 	Nice long weekend	I stayed here for three nights over the Queen's Birthday in a junior suite. The room was on the penthouse floor, although I can't remember what the name of the room was. It was large with a chaise longue and writing desk and faced out over the park. Pros: double-sinked bathrooms (the secret to harmony at any hotel), a big, hot shower, enormous, comfortable bed, robes and a view.Cons: super expensive internet, no separate conditioner (it was combined with shampoo - not good for long hair), no lift to the floor (just inconvenient if you have lots of bags), limited TV channels.I booked through the hotel website, and paid around 220 GBP per night. Standard rooms were even cheaper. I would probably stay again because I think this is an excellent price for this standard of hotel in London. The only thing that would stop me is the internet fee as I can't travel without it.

Jul 1 2008	Very nice a bit bland and boring.	Stayed with my husband for 5 nights. The Cavendish has the listed address, but also an entrance on Jermyn Street, across from Fortnum and Mason, and in the midst of all the wonderful Jermyn Street boutiques. It is about midway between the Picadelly Circus and Green Park Underground stops, a few minutes either way. This is really a very nice hotel, but the rooms are small (and we travel a lot). We have been to London several times, and this location is good, but the nearby restaurants are expensive, even by London standards. I just personally feel that other areas, especially Marylebone, are more fun. And, for the money, I think we could have done better.BUT, MOST IMPORTANT, this hotel WORKS. Meaning, the air conditioning functioned. Rooms were serviced promptly, extra towels arrived promptly when I asked, and the maid refused a tip.This hotel is a good solid choice, no surprises, but no action in the area, either, so you have to make your own choice. Looked like a good choice for business travellers, free wi-fi in the lobby.London is about the greatest city in the world. Go and have a good time, and try to forget how obscenely expensive it is.RE restaurants: Find Shepherd's Market off side streets on the other side of the Green Park stop. Several cute reasonable places there, loved "The Market Brasserie" (French). Did not like Getti's on Jermyn St, but really liked Rowley's, also fairly reasonable.

Jul 1 2008 	Gem of a hotel!	I have just returned from a two-night weekend stay which I booked as a surprise 30th birthday gift for my partner, along with tickets to see We Will Rock You. First and foremost, the location is FANTASTIC! It is situated on Jermyn St, directly opposite Fortnum and Mason and parallel to Picadilly. It is within easy walking distance of atrractions such as St James' Park, Leicester Square and Buckingham Palace. As I am not keen on the tube, it was ideal as we were able to walk everywhere, including Covent Garden and the London Eye. It is a stone's throw from the West End/Soho and Theatreland, so it is ideal if you are planning on seeing a show. I booked a Classic Double Room online at the Advance Purchase Rate, which was 288 for two nights, including the buffet breakfast. Given the location and the fact that this is a 4* hotel, I felt that this price was excellent value, especially as the breakfast is usually 21pp. The room itself was pretty small, but well kept. The bed was the comfiest bed I have ever encountered! The room had a desk, drinks making facilities, minibar and safe. There was also a plasma screen TV and CD player too. The bathroom was also quite small but was beautifully finished and had a huge walk-in power shower. Breakfast is buffet-style and is served until 12 noon. There is a great selection, including cereals, breads/pastries, cheese, cold meats, fresh fruit and cooked breakfasts. You can also order various other items in addition to the self-service items. We also had a pre-theatre dinner at the restaurant, which was delicious and at 14.95 for two courses wa excellent value for London. My only problem with the restaurant is that service can be quite slow, particularly at busy times.The hotel in general is styled in a contemporary manner and although the hotel has 15 floors, the shared areas such as the bars and lobby are not particularly big, which gives it a nice, intimate feel. The bar and lounge prices are expensive (9 for two bottles of beer and 4.80 for a coffee!), which is a shame really because we certainly would have spent more time in there if it hadn't been for this.The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I managed to get a CD stuck in the CD player on the second evening and I informed the gentleman at reception on my way out. By the time we got back, it had been fixed and they had even put my CD back in the right case, without a scratch on it!I will definitely book the Cavendish if I return to London in the future. For the price I paid, the excellent location and the general pleasantness of stay, I don't think you could find any better in all of central London. I will certainly be recommending this hotel to others.

Jun 5 2008 	Just right.	I have just come back from staying at The Cavendish for one night which we won through work! The hotel is situated just off Regent Street in a very nice area. The reception is small but decorated very well with lots of purple and light(!!). The reception staff were efficient, polite and helpful (always a bit of a surprise in London!!).We had a twin room on the 5th floor. The room was small, but average for London. The decor was lovely, very modern. Spotlessly clean. The beds were soooo comfy. Some nice touches, like a revlon hairdryer in the room - ladies will appreciate. The only bad points - the TV didn't work - could only get BBC and it was quite noisy - sounded like we had a window open! Bar as expected was expensive over 10 for dark rum and coke! We went for breakfast in the resturant, it was self service but the food was fresh and hot. Very good as far as breakfasts go.... would say Hilton is better for breakfasts? But not overly concerned.Will recommend this hotel!

Jun 3 2008 	Nice Hotel Great Location	Stayed in the Cavendish from Friday 31st May - Sunday 1st June. Hotel is nice, and with the current exchange rate its quite 'cheap' by London standards for a 4 star hotel. Hotel is spotlessly clean, although the standard rooms are really small - my boyfriend is 6ft 2ins & his feet never saw the inside of the bed!! the rooms are clean, nicely decorated, bright, with very comfortable beds. We had a rate that included breakfast (got it on the hotel website and it was only 1 more expensive than the rate without breakfast??? go figure) anyway, we ordered breakfast to our room (no extra charge for this) and to be honest - I'm glad we didnt pay more than 1 for it - the bacon was totally dried up, the hash browns were flavourless, my poached eggs were done perfectly, but the scrambled egg my boyfriend got looked gross - he said it wasnt great at all. We got THE smallest pot of (cold) coffee for two people, and no salt / pepper on the tray. Overall the breakfast was a big disappointment - so much so that we decided to eat out on Sunday morning. The lobby of the hotel is quite nice, but really small for a hotel with so many rooms. The bar is also quite small and be warned - very expensive. 2 bottles of beer cost us 9 - whereas in the pub around the corner it was only 6 for the same 2 drinks. The location is second to none, you can walk everywhere (the Ritz is only around the corner). If you want a nice comfortable clean hotel in a great location in London - go for the Cavendish..

Jun 1 2008 	A gem near Piccadilly	I stayed here for three nights in May 2008. The Cavendish is a stylish boutique hotel with impeccible service. It's tucked down a quiet little street (Jermyn) and only five minutes walk to Piccadilly Circus. Also it's right opposite Fortnum & Mason which is a great place to splurge on a fancy English breakfast! I booked a Superior room for a little extra. The room was not large (but good for London). They called it a "City View" but there is nothing to see. The room itself was very well decorated, nice furniture (fee based internet if you need it) and a wonderful bed with down pillows. The bathroom is large and modern. It has a complicated tap system in the shower and weird semi see-thru doors.There is a small bar in the lobby. It's not very cosy but it's nice and gets busy late at night. On check-in they will give you gift coupons for the bar, which is a nice touch (if not, ask) The staff were very helpful and quick to assist at reception and a great concierge. Room rate was around 150 GBP a night which is a lot these days for us third-world Americans ;) but well worth it for a perfect weekend stay in London. Travelocity (pay in USD) gives a better price than the hotel web site.Tip: be sure to hang up the Do Not Disturb thingy; otherwise housekeeping are aggressive to get in early :)

May 31 2008 	terrific value	We stayed for 1 night in one of the junior suites which are situated on the top (15th) floor of the hotel. It should be mentioned that the lift service stops at the 14th floor, with 3 small flights of stairs giving access to the 15th. We normally stay at the Savoy but it is closed at the moment so we looked for a decent hotel in Piccadilly as we were in town to try a restaurant in Berkley Square. I chose the hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor and looking at a couple of booking agents websites. I was still a little apprehensive about things but when we found the hotel (set back from the road - you could miss it ) I relaxed.The lobby is mid sized and modern, check in was efficient. When we entered our room we both had the same reaction - result!The room was large, well furnished and spotless, and the bed was sublime. The best was yet to come however as the bathroom was simply brilliant. A large bath, double wash basins and an oversized shower, with plenty of towels etc. We've had this type of bathroom in the past but we didn't expect it at a 4 star. There were 2 Bose machines to use, a flat screen tv, and very importantly a kettle with tea and coffee available. It was very impressive, and I get harder to please as I get older. One niggle was the lighting system which was activated by putting the room key in a docking station by the door. I had to call reception to ask how we could turn off the lights without removing the key, but allowing a light to be used during the night. The hotel has 2 entrances, one on Duke St and the other on Jermyn St, opposite Fortnums. Breakfast was a very pleasant experience. Large comfortable,modern room with a choice of the usual hot/cold buffet. The food was hot and good quality, and the service was much better (efficient & friendly) than the Savoy. For the amount paid this was easily the best value I have had at an hotel for many years. I booked through Milesfaster and paid 240 incl breakfast and vat. My only complaint would be the lack of soundproofing. As mentioned we were on a floor above the lift but could still hear it clanking and banging - if you are a light sleeper this could be a problem. We would definately return.

May 31 2008 	Cavendish London --- Amazing!	We stayed at the Cavendish London in late-September of 2007. You may be able to find something cheaper, but I doubt it would be anywhere near as nice as this!

May 30 2008 	Good value Great location and staff	The location in Jermyn St (close to Piccadily, Trafalgar Square and all of the West End attractions) is excellent. May 26 2008	Great hotel great location!	Stayed at the Cavendish, following reviews on Trip Advisor. It was perfect. 50 mins from Heathrow on the tube and handy for everywhere. Staff were really friendly and the breakfast was excellent.

May 12 2008 	Fab location! Beautiful hotel!	I LOVED this hotel! It was my first time in London, and I did a ton of research to prepare. I booked the Cavendish based on TripAdvisor reviews, and I couldn't have been happier!The hotel is on Jermyn St., an adorable and quiet street in London lined with men's clothing stores. Across the street is Fortnum and Mason's, a really beautiful department store/market. One block up you have Piccadilly, and Soho is a short walk away (great restaurants here!!). The lobby area is really nice, and the concierges were really friendly and helpful. Everyone here was so nice to me. I stayed here alone for part of the time, but felt totally safe in the neighborhood and couldn't have been happier. So many things are within walking distance -- Buckingham Palace, St. James' Park, Green Park, Westminster Abbey, The London Eye, Parliament, Trafalgar Square, Oxford/Regent streets for shopping, Whitehall ... The location is seriously amazing. I couldn't believe it!The decor is stylish and modern. Stayed in an Executive Twin room for 7 nights in April. The room is a great size for two people. I had a couple of nights when the walls sounded kind of thin and I could hear the person next door, but ... well, it is London, and the building is really old and historic. Also, was located on the 10th floor and had amazing views of the London Eye and the Gherkin. The beds are sooo comfortable, with fluffy duvets. Breakfast was included - I started each morning here, and they have a wide spread of choices plus tea and coffee. Definitely get the rate with the breakfast included. You also get a newspaper with your room each morning, which I enjoyed.Stayed here again for 2 nights in May. Decided to try the Standard Room to save money, and it just does NOT compare. I was not impressed with the Standard Room, but the Executive Room is great. Lucky for me, the a/c broke in the Standard Room that first night so they upgraded me for free to an Executive Suite for my last night in London. That was such a treat!Can't wait to stay here again. I consider this a "mid range" hotel in terms of price. For my budget, I couldn't be happier. The location alone makes this hotel totally worth it ... just definitely get the Executive Room; it's worth the extra money.

May 11 2008 	fantastic value for money.	stayed here for two nights at the end of April. Reception staff were very good and efficient and the staff in general above average in service. The breakfasts were excellant and the food of a good quality., we had a standard room and were thrilled with the quality of the beds and linen as we had just had an exchausting week in Morocco and needed the sleep! Would happily stay here again. BTW I was suprised to read a previous review that mentioned the high cost of internet here. I use a WIFI device and had unlimited access to the internet with no charge, an excellant service.Would happily recommend the hotel

May 10 2008 	Great Location Nice Rooms	Stayed at The Cavendish for 4 nights on a recent business trip. The location can't be beat - just off Piccadilly, a 10 minute walk to Regent St, Grosvenor Square and 15 minutes to Buckingham Palace, etc. Was given a lower floor room - 3rd - but it was a "deluxe" at the end of a hall so it was basically a mini-suite. (Oh - and my room looked onto the backside of Fortnum and Mason - so lots of good food within a stone's throw.)Considering the rate of 260 pounds per night - a relative bargain in London for a mini-suite - I can't complain and would stay here again. May 7 2008 	Good location Clean boutique trendy style but noisy	Stayed here for 2nights, room 1102The rooms are indeed small, but that's very common in a metropolitan city in Europe (try Paris hotels!).I never have problems with tiny rooms. Boutiqe style. Furnitures are new, clean and stylish. Carpet clean.Bed was very comfortable and bouncy. Cd/Stereo player in the room (no external plug/usb/mp3 though)Location is perfect, just behind the Fortnum & Mason (I really have no clue what the fuzz is about that store).Despite the quiet street parallel to the busy Picadilly, it was still very noisy, because I got a room on the street side. No comments.Overall, I really like the hotel style, service, cleanness, location, trendy and comfortable bed. May 2 2008 	Great location but not quite there	We stayed in a standard double at The Cavendish and the room was definitely London small, but had some nice mod cons. I would describe it as OK rather than good (apart from the leaking sink tap). I booked this hotel for the location and for the quality breakfast described here on trip advisor. The location did not dissapoint and it really is right in the heart of London, but the food and service were poor for a hotel that prides itself on its culinary expertise. When the food turned up it was cold and I can only describe the scrambled eggs as mush on a plate. We also had to send one plate back twice due to errors, although the staff were very apologetic. Apr 29 2008 	Great value Penthouse Suite	We stayed for 3 nights in a Penthouse Suite (Room 1507) on the 15th Floor. For London this was absolutely excellent value for money with great views to the east taking in the London Eye and the City Financial District. The accommodation was very spacious. Entering through double doors into a small lobby you turn left into a large well appointed lounge with a wall mounted flat screen TV, a DVD player and a Bose sound dock for an iPod. There is a separate toilet and washbasin in the lobby area adjacent to the lounge as well as a small cloakroom for hanging your coats. To the right of the lobby is the bedroom with its own TV and a remote control Bose CD/radio and a very comfortable King Size bed of course. The bathroom is also very spacious, well appointed and has a large walk in shower as well as a good size bath tub for soaking in. The Housekeeping Manager for the 15th Floor knocked on the door to enquire if everything was to our satisfaction and within 5 minutes of mentioning that the bath robes were rather small two new large freshly laundered replacements were delivered to our door with a friendly smile.I have added some photos of the suite if anyones interested just to give some idea of style and layout and have pre-fixed them all with Room 1507 for ease of identification.The Cavendish is an excellent 4 star hotel with friendly and attentive staff. It is very well located at the junction of Duke Street and Jermyn Street only 5 minutes walk from Green Park Tube Station which is perfectly situated on the Piccadilly, Victoria and Jubilee Lines. Jermyn Street runs parallel to the busy Piccadilly and the hotel is roughly half way between Green Park and Piccadilly Circus. For Theatreland, the two next eastbound stops from Green Park are Piccadilly Circus and Leicester Square, although you can walk to Piccadilly Circus in only 6 minutes. One stop westbound is Hyde Park, or a pleasant 5 minute stroll across Green Park takes you to Buckingham Palace, or one stop north takes you to Bond Street for the shops there and on Oxford Street. Not only that one stop south on the Jubilee Line is Westminster for Big Ben, the Houses of Parliament, Downing Street, Westminster Abbey and the London Eye. So I think to describe the hotel as being well located is certainly justified.Just two other things to mention; some of the best deals are for non-refundable advance purchase direct on the hotel website, make sure you include breakfast as its very expensive to order as an extra. Also, the pre-theatre dinner menu at 14.95 served from 5.30pm onwards is very good value.All in all, we would certainly go back.

Apr 23 2008 	Great Stay !!!	My wife and I stayed at the Cavendish last week. Mar 25 2008	Luxurious but affordable	We stayed at The Cavendish on the Thursday before Good Friday, as we had a meal booked in town. Mar 22 2008 	Cavedish Lift Noise	I stayed with my wife in mid-March for two nights in a Junior Suite.Staff, breakfast and location all excellent - an enjoyable weekend.One word of warning though - if you book a 15th floor room, do not accept room 1502.
