Mar 21 2008 	BOO!! good location but rooms only big enough for a bed!!	we stayed at the cavendish for 2 nights, 2 weekends ago.we previously stayed at the royal park hotel 6 mths ago. RP is a charming hotel but we wanted to try another part of town.we arrived and liked the fact the lobby resembled the photos taken by guest (good job!). check in was easy and we were given a room on the 10th floor. i had asked before we went up to the room if this was the best room they had available for our price bracket. they said yes. got to the room and mouth dropped. first thing we noticed was the size. the room about 11sqm/118sft. we had two small carry ons with us so when we put them on the floor at the foot of the bed, there was no room to pass. second thing was a howling noise. i thought the window was opened but it wasn't. they were not sound proof (and no, i'm not from the countryside and love city noises but this was too much). the wind against the cheap windows was so loud it was like a ghost was in the room... or you were in a tunnel.so we called down and ask if it was possible to change or upgrade our room and we were told we could for an additional 30 for each night we were staying. we said no because it wasn't worth it. we were already paying 150 for a walk-in closet and a newspaper. 180 can get you a different class of hotel in the neighborhood.because we were in LDN for fun, we ignored the room flaws, had a good time and just slept with ear plugs.on checkout, they tried to charge us for food we didn't eat from the minibar and that's when i wrote off this hotel completely. i don't like it when hotels are cheap with their guests, especially when they are not full. ok, enough of my [-].positives: decor was fresh. everything was clean. no chips on the wall, etc. nice shower/ bathroom. tiny but not leaky. bottom line: there are better hotels in town that give you more for your money.

Mar 5 2008 	Good hotel great location	Stayed for one night, 1st March. Hotel is in a great location and it was a very pleasant stay. Checked in no problem at 2pm. Mar 4 2008 	Piccadilly Utopia	Excellent accomodation. Booked a suite on the 15th floor with fantastic views. Staff all extremely helpful, food great value at 15pp for a pre-theatre meal (2 course). Feb 29 2008 	Good for the Money - nice but not stuffy	We stayed here for 1 night in early Feb as I had booked a wine tasting day at the Londons Vinopolis and so we thought it would be nice to stay.We arrived at the hotel after travelling by train and the hotel looked nice and clean. Reception took a while to book us in but only because the man on the phone was having difficulty explaining to someone on the phone that they don't do single rooms, and they would have to have a double and pay the double rate. Went on for ages!But after that we went to our room - which in all honesty was quite small really - but it was the standard room we booked and we got it for 183 including breakfast for two so whos complaining. The only thing I would say is the room was musty smelling - each time we would walk in it wuld hit you. We had to open the windows when we were in it to tr and get some fresh air. The location (like everyone says and the reason we choose it) is fantastic! We walked to China Town and Leicester Square and Bond Street. And then got taxis to Harrods etc as got abit lost and walked in completely the wrong direction. We had a walk rounf Hyde Park on the Sunday morning which was lovely as it was all sunny - we were waiting for the shops to open and wanted to kill abit of time.The only thing I got grumpy about it nothing to do with the hotel per say - but just London in general. We have visited Londn several times for nights out and hav stayed in different hotels like the Berkely, Metropolitan, Raddisons, Westbury etc etc, and this hotel was good value for the money. HOWEVER I don't get why people are so happy to take terrible service from restaurants and still pay tips there! We had a bad experience at lunch which put us in abad mood i guess - as we waited 2 and half houts before we had our main meal! Then when we said something - the waiter just said everyone had complained and thats was it. Then we were looking for somewhere to have dinner - and shouldn't have but got tired of walking - so ended up in a Angus steak bar - we both love steak and they were heaving so thought must be good. Well we got stuffed in the back - where they had cut the width of the table to half to make it fit and you couldn't get your leg past the table leg - and then we had our steaks which were ordered rare and came so overcooked I don't think anyone would have ate them. This from a place that specialises in steaks - then we sent them back and they were ok when they came again - but half my husbands was full of threads which meant he couldn't cut through it. Then when we got the bill we were shocked to see - we had to pay 1 eac for some bread they had brought wihtout asking, and the chips and potato we had with th steak were extra. So we paid over 50 for two steaks (not very nice ones) and 2 diet cokes!!! How mad is that!! And the people round us who complained about there food etc kept leaving 10 tips!!!! I don't get it!!!But hey - thats no reflection on the hotel - they did a nice menu which we could have had but had 2 courses for the same cost - but we thought hotel food would be more than walking and finding somewhere. Hey - you learn.So basicaly - sorry for the rant - but the hotel is great locaton, OK beds, small rooms, nice breakfast!!!!! and easy to get to etc.Would go back if needed central location again.

Feb 27 2008	Great Stay Once Again at this Hotel	We stay at this hotel every time we come to London and this must be about our 10th stay. Feb 24 2008 	Modern Hotel GREAT LOCATION	We have just returned from a weekend break at London, staying at The Cavendish Hotel. Feb 19 2008 	Little Things Mean a Lot	Once again The Cavendish has come up trumps for my wife and I on our second visit in four months thanks to the Website Auctionair. Feb 11 2008 	A Fantastically wonderful hotel - can not wait to go back	I stayed in this Hotel in January and after reading several reviews was slightly wary of staying here. We put one foot inside the hotel and there was a gentleman there to greet us with a fantastic attitude to his job and instantly took both our very heavy suitcases of us. We then checked in and as it was only a few minutes after 12 noon our room wasn't ready, but we were extremely hungry so decided to have lunch in the lounge area on the first floor - and it was absolutely amazing and well worth the money about 20 for two.When we went back down to reception our room was ready. The Room was HUGE. I've stayed in many a standard hotel room and by far this was the biggest and best. We discovered this when my friend went to use the bathroom and the bellboy arrived with our luggage at the same time. Feb 5 2008 	Junior Suite - Excellent but make sure you get room 1503	stayed in room 1503 which is a penthouse junior suite. booked directly with hotel and paid 253 for 1 night stay which included breakfast. after reading many reviews on here decided to opt for the cavendish due to recommended location and level of sevice experienced by other tripadvisors and was not dissapointed on either count. on arrival we were assigned room 1505 which had no lcd tv and despite the large oversize bathroom did not really feel like a suite(or even a junior suite). wasn't happy at all with this so went down to reception to air my feelings - beware when booking a suite, they don't all have lcd tv's as you are led to believe on the website - reception staff very helpful and quick to react, spoke to manager and was offerred different suite but also no lcd tv. i told them this was not acceptable either and they should either give me a discount or find me a room which met the description on the website. within 15 minutes they managed to assign me room 1503 which is most likely the exact room you see on the picture in the website and definitely better than 1505. it was a different layout(i think 1505 was on a corner) and felt much larger and a proper junior suite with an enormous bathroom, excellent double sized power shower. separate bath and his n hers sink/vanity areas. the lcd tv is only about 28 inch but has sky sports 1, 2, and 3. now i felt like i was getting some value for my money - if that is possible in a london hotel!. 10 out of 10 for staff attitude and willingness to help with my problem, they really did excel themselves and turned my stay from a dissapointing one to a thoroughly enjoyable and pleasant one. everything else has been well documented in previous reviews, excellent breakfast, large comfy beds(although the mattresses are very soft indeed so if you are used to a firm mattress then you may not get a great nights sleep), great staff attitude and willingness to help, and great location. all in all, i would stay again and would recommend to other readers. a very well run hotel indeed.

Jan 29 2008 	great location but small rooms	Have stayed here before and the location cannot be faulted. Jan 26 2008 	Mmm Breakfast	A perfect place to stay to see a London show, with major theatres within walking distance. Jan 24 2008 	Great location small rooms	We booked this hotel for 3 nights stay in January 2008 via a special Travel Zoo rate of 85 pounds/night + tax (approx 100 pounds) for a Superior Room. Jan 18 2008 	Fantastic location	Stayed here for 2 nights over weekend break to London. Location was fantastic for seeing sights, theatre district and shopping. Jan 9 2008 	Not 4 Star Service! Disappointed!	Myself and my husband stayed here for 2nights over New Year. Check in was fine, room was fine on the 10th floor, nice large bed, nothing overly 3 Star. I had booked through Active Hotels as usual, 390 for the 2 nights room only. They were charging 21 p.p for breakfast so we went to a little Italian just on the right as you approach Piccadilly Circus and had a scrumptious breakie there for 12 for the two of us. We flew into Stansted and got the train/tube to Green Park stop, 5min walk then to hotel. We didnt dine in the hotel due to previous reviews and anyway I wanted to get out and see about me. The first night New Years Eve we dined in the Avenue just down a side street off the hotel towards St James Pk. Very nice indeed, excellent service and modestly priced for good food! Second night as we were booked to go to the theatre we dined in China Town, Crispy Duck Restaurant (ask for a table on 2nd floor), lovely meal and reasonable price.Prices - The only time we drank in the hotel bar was New Years Eve after we returned from the London Eye and fireworks, we had one drink. Glass of champs and a coke 14. Also like to point out the prices are scandalous in the mini bar in the room, can of coke 2.50, and wait for it.a kitkat 1.50rip off! There is a Tesco at the end of street get your bits from there, but as it was closed over new year when we were there we werent able to avail of it!Service  The hotel bar was closed on New Years Eve, go figure! In saying that it wasnt really a bar, but more an add-on in the corner of the lobby with a scattering of chairs. This is supposed to be a 4star hotel, so you would expect 4 star service, think again! On check in I gave them a swipe of my credit card only to find on check out that they had actually charged 500 onto my card at that time. When I tried to pay on check out the receptionist made a big deal/show, saying that my card was declined, when I knew that the 403 of a bill should have gone easily on it! So got them to phone up the card company and it transpired that yes indeed they were holding the initial charge so they were trying to charge me 903 for my 2night stay! When I informed the receptionist Frankie of this he just shrugged his shoulders and said that he couldnt take off the charge until I paid the 403. As I had been at reception now for 45mins and was in a rush to get the tube/train to catch a plane I agreed to do this and told my card operator to watch out for the 500. A week later and several phone calls later it still isnt sorted out! So beware! I felt that the Cavendish staff didnt handle this situation well at all and that the receptionist staff could be doing with some training in Customer Service befitting a 4 Star hotel! So on the whole I wouldnt recommend this hotel. I will be staying elsewhere with better service and facilities for the price!

Jan 5 2008 	Excellently Located - The Cavendish	We have now had two stays at this hotel - in September and November and are about to stay once more in January. Jan 4 2008 	Brilliant Hotel	Stayed for 3 nights between Xmas & New Year in a superior double room. Our early check in was faultless and the room was modern, spacious (for central London), clean & very comfortable. Jan 3 2008 	Absolutely Wonderful!	My husband and I just returned home from our 7 night stay with The Cavendish in London and I must say we couldn't have been more pleased.
